title: Add a hash function for tensor data
body_html:
Hi,

I'm looking at the def __hash__() method defined in Tensor base class. That function builds off on python's id() method, which runs on CPU right? Is there a way to hash a tensor on GPU and use the hashed value as index to store this Tensor?
body_text:
Hi,
I'm looking at the def __hash__() method defined in Tensor base class. That function builds off on python's id() method, which runs on CPU right? Is there a way to hash a tensor on GPU and use the hashed value as index to store this Tensor?
body:
Hi,

I'm looking at the `def __hash__()` method defined in Tensor base class. That function builds off on python's `id()` method, which runs on CPU right? Is there a way to hash a tensor on GPU and use the hashed value as index to store this Tensor?
